nodes.label: Ferritin
nodes.description: Iron storage protein, elevated in inflammation, low in deficiency.

nodes.label: Iron
nodes.description: Serum iron level, low in deficiency or inflammation.

nodes.label: Transferrin Saturation (TSAT)
nodes.description: Percentage of transferrin bound to iron, low in deficiency.

nodes.label: Hemoglobin
nodes.description: Oxygen-carrying protein in red blood cells.

nodes.label: Mean Corpuscular Volume (MCV)
nodes.description: Average red blood cell size.

nodes.label: Red Cell Distribution Width (RDW)
nodes.description: Variation in red blood cell size.

nodes.label: High-Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein (hsCRP)
nodes.description: Marker of systemic inflammation.

nodes.label: Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone (TSH)
nodes.description: Pituitary hormone regulating thyroid.

nodes.label: Free Thyroxine (FT4)
nodes.description: Active thyroid hormone.

nodes.label: Free Triiodothyronine (FT3)
nodes.description: Active thyroid hormone.

nodes.label: Total Cholesterol
nodes.description: Total blood cholesterol level.

nodes.label: Low-Density Lipoprotein (LDL)
nodes.description: Bad cholesterol.

nodes.label: High-Density Lipoprotein (HDL)
nodes.description: Good cholesterol.

nodes.label: Triglycerides
nodes.description: Blood fat level.

nodes.label: White Blood Cell Count (WBC)
nodes.description: Leukocyte count; elevated in infection or inflammation.

nodes.label: Glucose
nodes.description: Blood glucose; low can occur in acute illness or fasting.

nodes.label: Inflammation-mediated iron sequestration
nodes.description: Inflammation causes iron to be stored in macrophages, reducing serum iron.

nodes.label: Iron deficiency pattern
nodes.description: Low iron stores and serum iron with microcytic anemia.

nodes.label: Hypothyroidism pattern
nodes.description: Elevated TSH with low thyroid hormones.

nodes.label: Dyslipidemia pattern
nodes.description: Abnormal lipid levels, often with hypothyroidism.

nodes.label: Anemia of inflammation
nodes.description: Anemia due to chronic inflammation sequestering iron.

nodes.label: Iron deficiency anemia
nodes.description: Anemia due to insufficient iron.

nodes.label: Hypothyroidism
nodes.description: Underactive thyroid gland.

nodes.label: Subclinical hypothyroidism
nodes.description: Mild thyroid dysfunction with normal hormones.

nodes.label: TSAT measurement
nodes.description: Test to measure transferrin saturation.

nodes.label: Ferritin measurement
nodes.description: Test for iron stores.

nodes.label: Thyroid peroxidase antibodies
nodes.description: Test for autoimmune thyroid disease.

nodes.label: Soluble transferrin receptor (sTfR)
nodes.description: Test to measure soluble transferrin receptor for iron deficiency differentiation.

edges.rationale: Elevated hsCRP indicates inflammation, which can sequester iron in macrophages.
edges.source_note: Curated from hematology guidelines on anemia of chronic disease.

edges.rationale: Elevated WBC can support inflammatory context; leukocytosis often accompanies acute or chronic inflammation.
edges.source_note: Hematology guidelines on inflammation and anemia.

edges.rationale: Low glucose can occur in acute illness or stress; non-specific supportive of inflammatory context.
edges.source_note: General medicine on illness and glucose.

edges.rationale: Inflammation causes ferritin to rise as an acute phase reactant.
edges.source_note: Williams Hematology, chapter on iron metabolism.

edges.rationale: Iron is sequestered, reducing serum iron levels.
edges.source_note: Review on iron homeostasis in inflammation.

edges.rationale: Low serum iron leads to low TSAT.
Chronic inflammation can lead to anemia by impairing erythropoiesis.
edges.source_note: Curated from multiple studies on anemia of inflammation.

edges.rationale: Anemia of inflammation is normocytic or mildly microcytic.
RDW is typically normal in anemia of inflammation.
edges.source_note: Review on red cell indices in anemias.

edges.rationale: Low iron intake or absorption reduces serum iron.
Low iron leads to low TSAT.
High ferritin supports inflammation over deficiency.
TSAT helps differentiate inflammation from deficiency.
Subclinical has high TSH but normal T4/T3.
Subclinical may have mild lipid effects.
sTfR helps differentiate inflammation from deficiency.
sTfR is elevated in iron deficiency.
